title.narrative: DJ-Rural Community Development and Water Mobilization Project (PRODERMO)

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to increase access of rural communities to water and enhance their capacity to manage water and agro-pastoral resources in the project areas using a participatory approach to community-based development.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Agriculture, Water, Fisheries, Livestock and Halieutic Resources (MAEPERH)
Ministry of Economy and Finance in charge of Industry

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :4.01.(a) | Description :Recipient has adopted an Operations Manual, satisfactory to IDA. | Due Date :19-Jan-2012

Finance Agreement :4.01.(b) | Description :The PMU has selected and engaged services of a finance & admin. specialist for the PMU,a procurement specialist, and an accountantfor the Project under terms of reference satisfactory to IDA. | Due Date :19-Jan-2012

Finance Agreement :4.01.(c) | Description :Project accounting system in place, with adequate in-built controls, capable of trackingProject resources & expenditures & generating financial reports, including interim unaudited fin. reports. | Due Date :19-Jan-2012
Finance Agreement :4.01.(d) | Description :The National Steering Committee has been established by the Recipient in a mannersatisfactory to IDA. | Due Date :19-Jan-2012
Finance Agreement :4.01.(e) | Description :The PMU has been established by the Recipient within the MAEM-RH in a mannersatisfactory to IDA. | Due Date :19-Jan-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.1. | Description :National Steering Committee with overall resp. for Project oversight,inter-agency coord. and policy guidance according to POM requirements, criteria, org. arrangements and op. procedures. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.2. (continued) | Description :The PMU will coordinate day-to-day Project activities,including responsibilities for reporting, auditing, procurement and financial management under the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.2. (continued) | Description :The Recipient shall not assign, amend, abrogate or waiveany provisions of the POM without prior approval of IDA. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.2. | Description :Recipient to carry out the Project through PMU, and PMU regionaloffices in Obock and Dikhil, according to POM requirements, criteria, org. arrangements and op. procedures. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.3. | Description :Local Development Committees shall prepare the Hydraulic and PastoralPlanning Schemes with support of the PMU in consultation withthe Beneficiary Communities. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.4. | Description :The Beneficiary Communities will participate in the identification,applicable co-financing, management, and maintenance of the Community Investment Subprojects. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. A.5. | Description :At all times during Project implementation, Recipient shall maintainthe National Steering Committee, and the PMU with a composition, resources, and terms of reference satisfactory to IDA. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. C.1. | Description :MAEM-RH, through the PMU, shall carry out the implementation of thenon-income-generating and income-generating Community Investment Subprojects for the benefit of the Community Beneficiaries. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. C.2. | Description :For those Subprojects encompassing income generation, MAEM-RH/PMUshall make Community Subproject Grants in accordance with eligibility criteria & procedures acceptable to IDA set forth in POM. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. C.3. | Description :MAEM-RH, through PMU, shall make each Community Subproject Grant/CSGunder a CSG Agreement with Beneficiary Community Benefiting from a Community Subproject on terms & conditions approved by IDA. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. D.1. | Description :Recipient to carry out Project in accordance with provisions of POM,ESIA, ESMP, and ESMF, & wherever applicable, Subproject EIAs,& ESMPs & not waive, revise provisions w/o prior IDA approval. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. D.2. | Description :In case of adverse environ./social impacts MAEM-RH shall carry out aSubproject EIA and a Subproject ESMP, as the case may be, satisfactory to IDA, in accordance with the provisions of the POM. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. D.3. | Description :MAEM-RH to ensure adequate information on implementation ofSubproject EIAs and Subproject EMPs is suitably included in the ProjectReports referred to in Section II.A of Schedule 2 of the FA.| Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section I. D.4. | Description :MAEM-RH shall ensure that all measures identified and described inthe Subproject ESMPs are taken in a timely manner. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Number of functional income-generating activities (1 year after their creation) (Number, Custom Breakdown) (Number, Custom)
Number of income-generating activities supported by the project (Number, Custom) (Number, Custom)
Increase in the number of constructed/rehabilitated water structures supported by the project (Number, Custom)
Number of SAAHPs prepared and being implemented (Number, Custom)
Number of functional sub-projects 1 year after their completion (Number, Custom)

Number of persons trained in: (i) water resource management, (ii) agro-pastoral resource management, (iii) participatory planning and development, and (iv) income-generating activities (Number, Custom
Increase in the percentage of women in the managing committees (CPL and CGEP) (Percentage, Custom)
Number of women income-generating activities created/reinforced (Number, Custom Breakdown) (Number, Custom)
Grievences registred related to delivery of project benefits that are actually addressed. (Percentage, Custom)
Area of grazing areas set aside and/or rehabilitated by soil and water conservation works (Hectare(Ha), Custom)
New fisheries marketing and storage infrastructure constructed/rehabilitated under the project (Number, Custom)
Indicator Two: Increase in the number of heads of livestock with more secure access to water within a reasonable distance (20 km radius) in the project areas
Indicator One: Increase in the number of rural households with more secure access to drinking water within a reasonable travel time(two hours roundtrip) in the project areas
Indicator Three: Communities in the project areas are organized in community-based structures (CPLs, CGEPs and women/fishermen associations) that actively prepare and implement SAAHPs
Area provided with new/improved irrigation or drainage services (Hectare(Ha), Corporate)
Increase in the total capacity of constructed/rehabilitated water structures supported by the project (Number, Custom)
